result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devaute R Ferguson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Devaute R Ferguson in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Devaute R Ferguson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed and read-in to case 14CF2532 for the purposes of sentencing.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant Devaute R Ferguson not in court, in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for Tom Potter for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant is receiving treatment.  There is no doctor's report filed for today's hearing.  Branch 19 is in jury trial on another case.    Court ordered case adjourned for return on doctor's reort in Branch 19.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
from Dr. McGlynn dated 7/30/15, received and filed
Report from DHS dated 07/30/2015 received and filed.
Letters from WCS that defendant will be admitted to MMHI on 06/24/2015.
Letter from WCS, defendant is still awaiting transfer to MHI.
Letter from WCS, defendant is still awaiting transfer to MHI.
Letter from WCS that defendant is awaiting transfer to MHI.
Pre-trial incarceration credit form received and filed.

Defendant Devaute R Ferguson in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Devaute R Ferguson in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for return on doctors report.  Parties review and do not contest  Doctors Report dated 05/13/2015  Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  The Court further authorized DHS to administer medications or treatment to the defendant.  Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility.  Order of Commitment signed and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for Return of Doctor's Report.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Forensic Report received and filed.  Parties notified report is available for pickup in Branch 22.

Attorney Lisa M. Procaccio in court, defendant Devaute R Ferguson not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties request return on doctors report be moved from 05/18/2015 to 05/19/2015 at 1:30pm.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.

Defendant Devaute R Ferguson in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  Defendant Devaute R Ferguson in custody.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Court tolled time limits.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
